alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued June 03 at 3:15AM EDT until June 03 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.8 to 8.0 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...This evening. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide this evening will occur around 8:21 PM at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible up to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/08 AM 6.3 0.5 1.4 N/A None 03/08 PM 7.9 2.1 1.5 N/A Moderate 04/09 AM 6.5 0.7 1.6 N/A None 04/09 PM 8.1 2.3 1.6 N/A Major 05/09 AM 6.6 0.8 1.8 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
